channel.title: TGaceAllStories
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from TGaceAllStories, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump sees ‘massive wealth’ from Venezuela’s oil as companies meet at White House. Experts doubt how soon it could flow.
item.description: President Donald Trump has invited U.S. oil companies to a meeting at the White House on Friday, which is expected to begin at 2:30 p.m. Eastern time.

item.title: ‘He even bragged about his Mercedes-Benz:’ I rejected two egotistical advisers. I managed my life savings and they tripled over 25 years. Did I do OK?
item.description: “We do not take out-of-country or five-star vacations. Instead, we enjoy time with family and friends and hobbies.”

item.title: Mortgage rates drop below 6% for the first time in 3 years as Trump administration starts purchasing mortgage bonds
item.description: The average rate on a 30-year fixed-rate mortgage fell to a near two-year low following Trump’s announcement about mortgage bonds.

item.title: Oil rises 3% this week — and not just because of Venezuela
item.description: Control over Venezuela’s oil has been in the spotlight all week, but developments in Iran are key to crude’s latest rise.

item.title: Want to retire from a soul-sucking job? Here are the financial factors to consider.
item.description: Also: Buy signals for bonds and stocks, words of wisdom from the Moneyist and how to navigate a tech career as AI disrupts the labor market.

item.title: Buy Amazon for a prospective breakout, says Carter Worth
item.description: From here, the chart analyst thinks owning Amazon will generate positive alpha.

item.title: Trump orders mortgage bond purchases to lower rates. These stocks are jumping in response
item.description: Analysts are now weighing the actual impact for consumers and what the move means for lending stocks.

item.title: History shows these stocks reporting earnings next week tend to beat expectations
item.description: Delta Air Lines and Bank of America are two companies reporting next week that have tended to beat Wall Street's expectations in the past.

item.title: Goldman says two plays on the senior housing boom can rally more than 20%. They also pay dividends
item.description: Goldman Sachs initiated coverage on two real estate investment trusts Friday.

item.title: Stars are aligning for Treasury yields to fall. This options trade hedges risk and makes money if rates dip
item.description: Jeff Kilburg breaks down this trade on the TLT ETF.

item.title: Monte Rosa Therapeutics (GLUE) Soars on Promising Inflammation Drug Data
item.description: Monte Rosa Therapeutics (GLUE) stock surges over 42% on positive Phase 1 data for MRT-8102, showing profound reductions in inflammation marker hsCRP. ...
